channel.title: CyberNetSec - Incident Response
channel.description: Latest incident response threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: Conduent Breach Exposes 10.5M Patients, Ranks as 8th Largest US Healthcare Breach
item.description:
Business services giant Conduent has disclosed a massive data breach that exposed the personal and medical information of over 10.5 million people, making it the 8th largest healthcare data breach in U.S. history. The breach, which was active for months between October 2024 and January 2025, has alr...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Regulatory, Incident Response

Read Full Article →

item.title: TriZetto Discloses Year-Long Data Breach Exposing Patient PHI
item.description:
TriZetto Provider Solutions, a healthcare revenue management company owned by Cognizant, has started notifying clients about a major data breach. An unauthorized party had access to patient data for nearly a full year, from November 2024 until the breach was detected on October 2, 2025. The attacker...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Incident Response, Regulatory

Read Full Article →

item.title: G7 Unveils New Framework for Coordinated Cyber Response in Financial Sector
item.description:
The G7 Cyber Expert Group has published a new policy paper outlining non-binding principles for Collective Cyber Incident Response and Recovery (CCIRR) within the global financial sector. The framework, developed to foster greater cross-border cooperation, aims to improve information sharing, stream...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Incident Response

item.title: Global Infrastructure Breach Alert Confirmed as False Alarm
item.description:
Initial reports on November 30, 2025, of a major security breach impacting global infrastructure were officially confirmed to be a false alarm. The panic was triggered when automated monitoring tools misinterpreted routine, benign system tests as a sophisticated cyberattack, leading to a cascade of ...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Security Operations, Incident Response, Other

Read Full Article →

item.title: Ransomware Attacks Peak on Holidays and Weekends, Exploiting Low Staffing
item.description:
A new global study by Semperis, the "2025 Holiday Ransomware Risk Report," confirms that threat actors strategically launch attacks during holidays and weekends to exploit reduced security staffing. The report found that 52% of organizations were targeted during these off-hour periods. Alarmingly, 7...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Security Operations, Ransomware, Incident Response

Read Full Article →

item.title: Major Wall Street Banks Exposed After Breach at Mortgage Vendor SitusAMC
item.description:
SitusAMC, a critical technology and services provider for the real estate finance industry, has disclosed a significant data breach discovered on November 12, 2025. The cyberattack compromised corporate information and, more critically, data belonging to its clients' customers, which could include s...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Supply Chain Attack, Incident Response

item.title: CrowdStrike Fires Insider for Leaking Screenshots to 'Scattered Lapsus$ Hunters' Hacking Group
item.description:
Cybersecurity giant CrowdStrike has confirmed it fired an employee last month for acting as a malicious insider. The employee leaked screenshots of internal systems, including an Okta dashboard, to the 'Scattered Lapsus$ Hunters' hacking group, who then posted them on Telegram. CrowdStrike stated th...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Incident Response, Threat Actor, Security Operations

item.title: AWS Outage in us-east-1 Knocks Major Global Services Offline
item.description:
A significant infrastructure fault within Amazon Web Services' (AWS) us-east-1 region in North Virginia on October 20, 2025, triggered a global outage affecting numerous major online services. Platforms including Snapchat, Fortnite, Disney Plus, and various banking applications experienced widesprea...

Severity: High

Categories: Cloud Security, Incident Response

Read Full Article →

item.title: GAME OVER: 'Operation Endgame' Dismantles Global Cybercrime Services
item.description:
In a massive international crackdown dubbed 'Operation Endgame,' law enforcement agencies from 11 countries, coordinated by Europol, have dismantled the infrastructure of three major cybercrime-as-a-service platforms: the Rhadamanthys information stealer, the VenomRAT remote access trojan, and the E...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Malware, Incident Response

Read Full Article →

item.title: Philippines Lawmakers Push for National Cybersecurity Fund
item.description:
In the Philippines, Representatives Migz and Luigi Villafuerte have introduced a proposal to create a 'Cybersecurity Risk Management and Mitigation Fund' (CRMMF). This dedicated national fund would provide the government with the necessary resources to prevent and respond to cyberattacks against bot...

Severity: Informational
